paragraphs.text: Welcome 2015: It may be two steps forward, one step back, but here's what matters.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Today, January 1, 2015 is the very first day of a brand new year
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And for many that means renewed efforts at a fresh start
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: New Year's resolutions, we call them
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: This is the year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It all starts now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We resolve to turn over a new leaf
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this time we're serious
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This time we're really going to try
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: we're not going to quit
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We promise ourselves that we're going to quit bad habits and start good ones
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We're going to get in shape, eat better, be more content, more disciplined, more intentional
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We're going to be better husbands, wives, fathers, mothers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We're going to work harder, serve more, plan more, give more, read more
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We're going to finally be all that we can be
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No more messing around
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Well
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I say try
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Seriously, try
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You might make some great strides this year
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I'm hoping to
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: There are a lot of improvements I'm hoping to make over the next 12 months
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But don't be surprised a year from now when you realize that you've fallen short... again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For those who try and try, year after year, again and again, to get better and better, only to take three steps forward then two steps back, one step forward then three steps back... I have good news for you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you're in good company!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Everybody I have ever talked to sounds just like me over the years
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Try and fail
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Fail then try
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Try and succeed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Succeed then fail
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Two steps forward. One step back. One step forward. Three steps back
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Every year I get better at some things, worse at others
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For example
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this past year I've become more patient with my children -- more tolerant of their mishaps
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Therefore
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I've been enjoying them more and micromanaging them less (one step forward)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: due to a lack of discipline on my part, I've also allowed myself to be stretched too thin this past year and as a result, those I love most have suffered (one step back)
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Furthermore
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: no matter how hard I try--no matter how serious I am about resolving to change-- I still get frustrated by the same things that frustrated me 20 years ago: traffic jams, unexpected interruptions, long lines, feeling misunderstood, and so on and so forth
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: You get the idea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In some ways we get better
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In some ways we get worse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And in other ways we basically stay the same
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whoever told us that the experience of life was one of escalating progress lied to us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Most of the time it feels rather static, doesn't it?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: New Year's Resolutions are a burdensome attempt to fix ourselves and make ourselves more lovable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But (and here's the good news), God loves us as we are, not as we should be
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: God's love for me, approval of me, and commitment to me does not ride on my resolve but on God's resolve for me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The good news that gets me through bad times is that God's devotion to me is not dependant on my devotion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Knowing that God always meets my messes with his mercy, my failures with his forgiveness, and my guilt with his grace, helps me survive my daily disappointments with me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Gospel of Jesus Christ is good news to those who've been crushed by unmet expectations of life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it announces that because Jesus won for you, you're free to lose
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because Jesus was strong for you, you're free to be weak
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because Jesus was extraordinary, you're free to be ordinary
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because Jesus succeeded for you, you're free to fail
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as this new year gets under way, I'll still going to try and get better at things
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's so much more restful to know that I live my life from love rather than for it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Thank God!
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Happy New Year!
paragraphs.label: other
